Hi Oliver,

can you tell me, which paper you mean? I also think that=
 self-organizing mechanisms that are influenced by input from the environme=
nt are an important ingredient for the emergence of functions. I think the =
papers that I mentioned in this post

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/ne=
at/message/5849

point to interesting concepts (e.g. self-stabilizing mecha=
nisms in neurons) that should be further investigated in simulations.

I al=
so enjoyed very much this paper "Evolution of declarative memory"

http://w=
ww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16881079

which makes the point that the anatomy=
 of the hippocampus (and therefore probably its function) is very well cons=
erved across mammals but depending on the neocortex to which it is attached=
 (e.g. in the fruit bat or chinchilla) the observable properties change. So=
 the behavioral function of a matured neural network should be distinguishe=
d from the properties of the network independent from its environment.
